pageContext.claim: “One thing I'll say about that Attorney General [Keith Ellison]. I have to say this. He was, like, the first one, he and a couple of people, he was sitting down being interviewed by George Stephanopoulos or somebody -- And he said -- No, but he was and he was like a Vice Chairman of the Democrat Party and you know who I'm talking about and he said 'Trump is going to win". This was, like, right after I came down the escalator with our future first lady, right? That beautiful Trump. The beau -- no? And he said, 'Trump is going to win.'  'No, no, no, you are, you're getting why, why.' 'No, no, Trump is going to win.'  So, I realized then he's a very smart person. I'm kidding.”
pageContext.analysis: Ellison did not say that Trump was "going to win"; he said Trump "might" win the Republican nomination: His comment earned a round of chuckles from the other guests, who at the time thought it was ridiculous, but he did not make such a declarative comment.
